website_summaries.verdict: A popular tent with many handy features.
pros: Two storage compartments, two doors, and secure weatherproofing
cons: Little extra space for gear once three people are inside
Though good at keeping rain out, it feels somewhat flimsy in windy weather

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this tent
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tent. I have two tents - one 2p Big Agnes tent that it essentially weightless and is great for intense backpacking (but pricey and super small). However, THIS tent is fantastic if you don't have to hike too long, or are okay carrying around the weight. It's a 3p tent and feels super spacious inside. I love the style/shape, which feels unique and makes me happy. It has a window/door on each side so the cross breeze is also fantastic. I use the tent with the footprint to ensure the tent lasts as long as possible and to keep things as dry as possible. Great purchase - I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: It came packaged like it was new but
customer_reviews.text: Just received this tent, and took it strait to the yard to set it up. The tent was USED, and not just once. It came packaged like it was new but, was covered in stains, and the inside had pine needles, sticks and dirt! The mesh on one of the windows was snagged in a few places as well.
customer_reviews.author: noahlar

customer_reviews.title: Good Y-Guides/Princesses tent!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put up on the first attempt (10-15 min. - which was at the campsite:-). Could use a couple more pockets for storage in the interior. Not tested by any weather, but seems to "breathe" well. Not big enough for three adults, unless someone wants to curl-up in the vestibule! Recommend you also get the Extreme 3 floor saver or a comparable tarp for under the floor. All in all, a really nice tent!
customer_reviews.author: SPYCHill

customer_reviews.title: Bad-ass
customer_reviews.text: We camp 3- 5 times a year. Bought this ALPS Mountaineering Extreme 3-Person Tent for my wife and I, on a week long trip. could not of asked for a better tent. we got hit by a severe thunder storm out in New Mexico. Stayed dry as a bone. Also, tone of room for the size. I'm 6ft and still had plenty of head and foot room. Plus gear in the tent. This company as a new Big fan for there products.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lauster

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS TENT.
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS TENT. Alps, although I wish their tent material was thicker, is slowly becoming the ONLY tent I buy. this is my second tent I have purchased and it will not be my last. Great purchase for the price. IF you take care of your tents, they can last you a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Marquiss

customer_reviews.title: Super large vestibule area to store gear
customer_reviews.text: Super large vestibule area to store gear. Neat how they have the doors open opposite of each other, good for catching the wind to keep you cool if it is hot outside. Tent well made but I had to read the instructions on how to set it up first time, totally different with the three poles crossing each other.
customer_reviews.author: rusl21

customer_reviews.title: Killer tent, not sure it's backpack worthy.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very durable, can handle the elements, very waterproof, nice look. CONS: On the heavy side, difficult to get back in storage sack.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I love this tent!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up & pull down. Tent handled 25-35 mph wind gusts, driving rains, sleet, & snow nightly. Coupled with the Alps ground cover for this tent I stayed dry & the all weather shell cut the wind completely. Great bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.author: Cold Fingers & Trout Flies

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TENT
customer_reviews.text: Got hit by huge thunder storm in Northern Montana. Poured all night not a drop inside. Great tent. Don't waste your money on a ridiculously expensive tent. This one will do the job! Sets up in 3 minutes. (Not including rain fly, add another 3 for this) Better for 2 than 3, but that is the case with all 3 person tents.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa E

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy tent. Easy to setup.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tent. Study. Very easy to setup and collapse (doable be a single person). A lot of space. Good ventilation. Used to have REI Taj 3 - this tent is quite similar.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Nasevicius

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent! I did a ton of research before ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tent! I did a ton of research before getting this one. You aren't going to find another tent that is of the same quality for this price. I'm sure I'll have it for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Good tent
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and durable , waterproof, lets the breeze in. I've just used it a few times camping with my sons in the summertime on Honshu (Japan main island) but no complaints thus far. It's plenty roomy enough for a dad and two elementary school boys. Good tent.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I've now used this in a stand alone (not staked) and staked environment. It worked perfectly each time. It goes up easy. Goes away easy. Fits back into it's bag. Roomy (for 2 people and gear) and the space outside the tent but under the fly is very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Scott

customer_reviews.title: Like: tent is easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Fits a Queens size bed. Feels strong. Easy to set up. Con: Hard to get in and out of the tend because of the steep entrance.
customer_reviews.author: whysea

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well for my 6'1" husband with lots of space for his camping gear.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Rothenbuhler

customer_reviews.title: All that I was looking for in a tent!
customer_reviews.text: I poured through countless tents for a few months until I finally decided on the Extreme 3-Person tent. It goes up extremely fast and has plenty of room for two people. Although the tent is listed as a 3 person, it would be a tight squeeze to sleep three people. It is very lightweight which was one of the major selling points for me. Although the floor material is thin, it appears to be durable, especially if a footprint is used. For the price, in my opinion, this tent is very tough to beat!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: The three person tent is really best for two people
customer_reviews.text: This tent was my home for 2 months in new zealand. Never had any issues with leaking or bugs getting in. The three person tent is really best for two people. The vestibules are enormous and helpful. Love this tent!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Whelan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: i love this tent. i have had three people in there just fine.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and keep you definitely very dry
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and keep you definitely very dry, even when it rains under 30 degrees temperatures!!. Very easy to set up and to pack, very light weight. Excellent product so far...
customer_reviews.author: kwroberts7

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice rectangular foot print and very easy to put up.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas K Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Great tent but really only for two people with gear.
customer_reviews.text: Tent is great! but smaller than you think really only fits two people.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: A very nice tent overall
customer_reviews.text: A very nice tent overall. Was a bit difficult to figure out at first but once everything was together it seemed very sturdy during a two night cold weather camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: S.Knox

customer_reviews.title: I love this tent so far!
customer_reviews.text: Things I should have considered.. It needs a footprint!!!!! No ifs, or ands.... Heavy tarp will work, BUT it needs something! Floor seems like it is made of the same material as the walls. actual size. This is pretty large for a tent. Still pretty light. Just an fyi to others. The directions for putting up the tent are actual sew inside the bag. I will update as I go..
customer_reviews.author: Julia B

customer_reviews.title: at tad heavy but worth it !
customer_reviews.text: it's a vacation home that can withstand gale force winds when you use some stronger stakes other than the ones supplied by the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin MacDowell

customer_reviews.title: To big of a bag.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tent but to big and heavy for backpacking. I returned it and got a marmot 2p.
customer_reviews.author: rolan

customer_reviews.title: great little tent
customer_reviews.text: great little tent. will totally keep you toasty and dry for late fall camping. the make is very sturdy and I think that overall, anything in this line is a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Tapril65

customer_reviews.title: The reviews on this are spot on! Definitely stoked about my purchase :)
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! The reviews on this are spot on. Definitely stoked about my purchase :) This tent is well put together
customer_reviews.author: KN

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Upon setting up the tent I discovered that an entire buckle is missing from the rain fly.
customer_reviews.author: iszystark

customer_reviews.title: dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a tent to withstand winds of about 35-50 mph gusts. From reviews and such I thought this was it. Its not. On the first night of winds the tent basically fell down. The wind flattened it like a pancake bending the aluminum poles. If you plan to be in winds of over 25-30 mph do not get this rent.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kohn

customer_reviews.title: Paper thin floor
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this tent, buy the floor saver also. I'd be surprised if the super thin flooring survived a trip without it. Other than that the tent is a good deal
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Quick to set up, and stays dry.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tent. Sets up in about five minutes by one person, and a queen sized inflatable fits perfect (snug). The vestibules are very nice to have, but as mentioned the zippers can get a little odd due to the angle of the rain fly. 30 minutes after setting this tent up for the first time, a downpour hit for about 20-30 minutes. Everything was nice and dry! This thing is great for one or two people, but man it would be tight for three unless two of them were children. For the price, this is a fantastic tent and I'd highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Get the Outfitter version.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great tent, but trust me, for what this is intended for you will NOT regret stepping up to the Outfitter version of this thing. Also, unless you wanna get REALLY cozy, this is better suited as a two man tent. It has the floor space to be a decent 3 man, but the walls slope inward a good deal meaning you're probably gonna feel a bit on the claustrophobic side with 3. Now, 2 adults and a kid would probably work, maybe 2 kids if the under 10. Or 2 adults and a dog, and maybe a kid.
customer_reviews.author: Random Citizen

customer_reviews.title: Great tent, great price
customer_reviews.text: The Alps Extreme 3 Tent is a great value. We were camping at the Sleeping Bear Dunes National Lakeshore in Northern Michigan in June and this tent performed extremely well in a 2 hour long torrential downpour. This was certainly thanks to the full length fly. I really have no complaints about the performance of this tent.
customer_reviews.author: John Lambert

product_meta.title: ALPS Mountaineering Extreme 3-Person Tent
feature_bullets: There's no assembly frustration with our Extreme Tent series; this free-standing, three-pole aluminum design is ideal for setup
Polyester tent fly resists water and UV damage while adding two vestibules for extra storage space
All vents can be fully closed on this four-season tent
Fully equipped with #8 zippers, mesh storage pockets, zippered mesh windows, two doorways, gear loft, aluminum stakes and guy ropes
Base Size: 6'8 x 8', Center Height: 50", Total Weight: 8 lbs. 2 oz. , Minimum Weight: 7 lbs. 8 oz. , Color: Orange/Gray
